summary: This bill, H.R. 229, was introduced in the House of Representatives by Rep. Hageman. Its sole purpose is to prohibit the implementation of a specific federal land use plan. The legislation directs the Secretary of the Interior to not implement, administer, or enforce the Rock Springs Field Office Record of Decision and Approved Resource Management Plan, which was published by the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) in December 2024. In essence, the bill seeks to legislatively block an administrative action by the BLM concerning natural resource management.
